Havard - Gorgas - Andrus - Lambert

SPECIAL ORDERS, }
No. 44. }

HEADQUARTERS DIVISION OF CUBA,
Havana, April 3, 1900.

1. In compliance with telegraphic instructions from the
Secretary of War, the following changes in the stations and
duties of medical officers in this Division are ordered:

Lieutenant-Colonel Calvin De Witt, Deputy Surgeon Gen-
eral, U. S. Army, Chief Surgeon of the Division, is relieved
from further duty in this Division and will proceed to New
York City, New York, reporting upon arrival thereat by
telegraph to the Adjutant General of the Army for further
orders.

Major Valery Havard, Surgeon, U. S. Army, is relieved
as Chief Surgeon, Department of Santiago and Puerto Prín-
cipe, and will proceed to Havana, Cuba, reporting to the
Division Commander for duty as Chief Surgeon, Division
of Cuba.

Major W. C. Gorgas, Surgeon, U. S. Army, is relieved as
Chief Surgeon, Department of Havana, and will proceed to
Santiago and report to the Commanding Officer, Department
Santiago and Puerto Príncipe, for duty as Chief Surgeon
of that Department.
The travel enjoined is necessary for the public service.

2. Under authority of paragraph 1, General Orders No.
24, current series, Headquarters of the Army, the Subsist-
ence Department will commute the rations of Sergeant Fred
Jacobson, troop E, 8th U. S. Cavalry, now on duty as clerk
at the Headquarters District of Puerto Príncipe, from and
including March 27, 1900, and while engaged in the per-
formance of such duty, at the rate of seventy-five (75)
cents per day, it having been and being impracticable to
provide for his subsistence in any other way.

3. The following named enlisted men of the Hospital
Corps, U. S. Army, are hereby relieved from duty at Mili-
tary Hospital No. 1, Havana, Cuba, and will report for
assignment to duty as indicated below:

To the Chief Surgeon, Department of Matanzas and
Santa Clara:

Hospital Steward Michael Denniny, Acting Hospital
Steward John Baigent, Privates Erick Erickson,
William Gabriel, John M. Hiser, Charles J. Heeb,
Theodore Hellwig, Hans Johnson, John Nicelay, Eddie
L. Retland, Harry A. Strause, Daniel P. O'Brien and
William Dixon.

To the Chief Surgeon, Department Province of Havana
and Pinar del Río:

Hospital Steward Patrick O'Neill, Acting Hospital
Steward Frederick L. Miner, Privates Gustav E.
Lambert, James J. Fuller, Dexter C. Loud, Robert
M. Hawn, John H. Andrus, Charles J. Dodds,
Charles A. Nelson, Dennis H. McCain, Franklin T.
Carter and Frank H. Charles.
To the Chief Surgeon, Department of Havana:

Hospital Steward Frederick Halstead, Privates Julius
Orgleman and Samuel Peterson.

To the Chief Surgeon, Department of Santiago and
Puerto Príncipe:

Hospital Steward Patrick Looby, Acting Hospital Stew-
ard Ralph E. Cross, Privates John E. Flynn, John
Kittleson, Oscar Larson, Charles E. Laurette, George
E. Schlobohm, Ernest E. Ware, Charles Calhoun, John
G. Bernhard, Charles W. Crane and Leonard M.
Himes.
To the Medical Supply Officer, Division of Cuba;

Privates James D. Davis, Richard Ebers, Frank Eckley,
John W. Rutledge and John Russell.

The Quartermaster's Department will furnish the neces-
sary transportation. The travel enjoined is necessary for
the public service.

4. The following named enlisted men of the Hospital
Corps, U. S. Army, are hereby relieved from duty at the
Medical Supply Depot, Division of Cuba, and will report
for assignment to duty as indicated below:

Private John Heil, to the Chief Surgeon, Department
Matanzas and Santa Clara;

Private Thomas E. Albertson, to the Chief Surgeon, De-
partment of Matanzas and Santa Clara;

Private Arthur Tucker, to the Chief Surgeon, Depart-
ment Matanzas and Santa Clara;

Private George W. Cade, to the Chief Surgeon, Depart-
ment Province of Havana and Pinar del Río;

Private Hugh McNiff, to the Chief Surgeon, Department
Santiago and Puerto Príncipe.
